definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: Tom scorched his jacket carelessly while he was smoking his pipe .
sentences.chinese: 湯姆抽菸鬥時不小心把夾克燒焦。

sentences.english: Say, do you smell something burning in the kitchen?
sentences.chinese: 喏，你有沒有聞到廚房裏有燒焦的味道呀？

sentences.english: Burnt sugar, used for coloring and sweetening foods.
sentences.chinese: 燒焦的糖，用於爲食物染色並使之變甜。

sentences.english: Her hair was singed and her anorak was burnt .
sentences.chinese: 她頭髮燒焦了，帶風帽的夾克也燒掉了。

sentences.english: Kurt watched the Pelicans fire their jets and scorch the grass.
sentences.chinese: 庫爾特看着鵜鶘運兵船點火，它們的噴焰把草燒焦。

sentences.english: The flames licked at the burned and charred support beams of Steve's little home.
sentences.chinese: 火焰將斯蒂夫家小屋子上的橫樑燒焦了。

sentences.english: How do you like the steak served, wee - done or underdone?
sentences.chinese: 她用半生不熟的鹹肉和燒焦了的餅乾招待我們。

sentences.english: Later it was named Burned End Lyre in honor of its burned tail.
sentences.chinese: 因爲它的一端是燒焦的，所以大家都叫它焦尾琴。

sentences.english: I rushed back to the kitchen just in time to save the food from getting burned.
sentences.chinese: 我衝回到廚房，剛好及時，飯沒被燒焦。

sentences.english: The meat got frizzled up because I forgot to turn the cooker off before we went out.
sentences.chinese: 肉燒焦了，因爲我們出門時我忘了關掉爐子。

sentences.english: Pearlescent coating is scorch and stain resistant.
sentences.chinese: 鮮亮的覆蓋材料可防沾污的燒焦。

sentences.english: Black soot from the detonated Black Hawk charred the wall of the animal pen.
sentences.chinese: 黑鷹爆炸的黑煙燒焦了畜欄的牆。

sentences.english: My sweater started to singe when I leaned over a burning candle.
sentences.chinese: 我俯身靠向燃着的蠟燭時把毛衣燒焦了。

sentences.english: Because of that, Gaddafi will destroy it. Scorched earth.
sentences.chinese: 因此，卡扎菲將會破壞它，燒焦土地。

sentences.english: Finally they found Jie and his mother scorched under a willow.
sentences.chinese: 最後他們發現傑和他的母親燒焦的柳樹下。

definition: a burn (tissue damage from heat, chemicals etc)/to burn (the skin etc)/(fig.) (of anger, jealousy etc) to hurt (sb)
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
